_meta.description: City-specific zoning and development standards for SB 1123 analysis
_meta.usage: Keyed by city name (matching Redfin CITY field). LA City is the baseline — other cities override where they differ.
_meta.data_gaps: See per-city 'unconfirmed' arrays for values that need verification from municipal code

Los Angeles.notes: All app defaults (proforma.js, listings_build.py) assume LA City rules

zone_mapping._note: Pasadena uses RS (single-family) and RM (multi-family) with density-per-acre suffixes

height_ft._note: Max height to ridgeline. RS zones unconfirmed — need Table 2-3 from PMC 17.22.040

height_notes.RM-32: 32 ft on lots <60 ft wide; rear 40% up to 36 ft on lots >=60 ft
height_notes.hillside_overlay: 28 ft max at any point if HD/HL overlay applies

setbacks_ft._note: RS zone setbacks unconfirmed — need Table 2-3. RM values partially confirmed.

far._note: RS zones use context-sensitive FAR: max floor area = 135% of median house size within 500-ft radius. No fixed FAR number.

rent_stabilization.name: Measure H (Fair and Equitable Housing Charter Amendment)

ellis_act.special_circumstances: elderly 62+, disabled, families with children under 18

rent_stabilization.difference_from_la: LA RSO: pre-Oct 1978, 2+ units. Pasadena: pre-Feb 1995, 2+ units — covers far more properties

impact_fees.notes: RIF is notably higher than LA City linkage fee. New RIF ordinance adopted Jul 2025 — amounts may have changed.

sb1123.status: Planning Commission reviewed Aug 2025, directed staff to prepare zoning amendments
sb1123.current_rules: State defaults apply (ministerial approval, 1200 SF min parcel, up to 10 units)

unconfirmed: RS zone height limits (need PMC Table 2-3)
RS zone side/rear setbacks (need PMC Table 2-3)
RM lot coverage maximums (need PMC Table 2-4)
Updated RIF amounts from Jul 2025 ordinance
sources: Pasadena Measure H / Rental Housing Board
